settingsPane.description: Be Sure ! If you benefit to the other's you will see it's effect. (Imam Ali ,a.s.)
settingsPane.name: Top Quote

settingsPane.description: If you don't believe in any religion and don't fear the Resurrection Day, at least be free in this world. (Imam Husayn ,a.s.)
settingsPane.name: Top Quote

settingsPane.description: I like to create new things and get better results by them. I named this Kernel to Gabriel as respect to God's Holly Angel.
settingsPane.name: History

settingsPane.description: Set desired Profile in Profiles tab, then you can modify it with what you need and like. If you found something wrong with this APP please remove /data/.gabriel directory, wait some seconds and reboot, it will load with default profile again. press backup settings in profiles tab and you can found it in /data/.gabriel folder or internal storage with the appended _backup to end of the base profile name, if you changed battery profile parameters it will be battery.profile_backup, it's your config and you can share it. In case of the config changes are not stable or thermal trigger has been activated with an aggressive thermal config you can reset profiles to their default parameters by flashing gabriel_profiles_reseter.zip which is located in internal storage.
settingsPane.name: Help

settingsPane.description: Stweak Master Switch for loading ALL settings on BOOT.
settingsPane.name: Global BOOT Settings

spinner.description: Master Switch - load ALL settings from ALL tabs on BOOT (Default: Load).
spinner.name: Enable On Boot

spinnerItem.name: Don't load all Settings on boot.

button.description: Push this button to manually load ALL settings in case of the master switch is (or already was) OFF and wait until Stweak reloads. When the Master Switch was already ON while phone was booting up, there is no need to use it.
button.name: Reload All Settings
button.label: Reload All

settingsPane.description: Control Fstrim on boot. it will run fstrim for data, cache, system partitions at end of the boot process.
settingsPane.name: Fstrim on Boot

spinner.description: Select Fstrim state
spinner.name: Fstrim State

settingsPane.description: Control double tap to wake function. by enabling dt2w system always listening to Touch screen and will be awake if you even put a finger on the LCD. (Default: disabled)
settingsPane.name: DT2W control

spinner.description: Select DT2W State
spinner.name: DT2W State

settingsPane.description: Disable for better file system performance at the risk of data loss in case of system crash (Default: enabled)
settingsPane.name: FSync control

spinner.description: Select FSync State
spinner.name: FSync State

settingsPane.description: The random number generator gathers environmental noise from device drivers and other sources into an entropy pool. The generator also keeps an estimate of the number of bits of noise in the entropy pool. From this entropy pool random numbers are created. Depends on Cortexbrain.
settingsPane.name: Entropy

spinner.description: Select availalbe entropy generator for Screen ON state.
spinner.name: Available awake entropy

spinner.description: Select availalbe entropy generator for Screen OFF state.
spinner.name: Available sleep entropy

settingsPane.description: Control Fentropy enForcer. Reboot needed.
settingsPane.name: Frandom Control

spinner.description: Select Frandom State
spinner.name: Frandom State

settingsPane.description: Keep Wifi or Data state ON or OFF on boot. These will Turn on at screen on state If you enabled Force auto-data and wifi in Tweaks tab.
settingsPane.name: Wifi and Data on Boot

spinner.description: Select Wifi State
spinner.name: Wifi State

spinner.description: Select Data State
spinner.name: Data State

settingsPane.description: Here you can change the way kernel modem driver operate in suspend state, by default kernel put Modem to suspend state when screen is OFF for long time, and delay DATA traffic. This will save power, if you need instant notifications from your apps over DATA connection, you can switch the Modem state to Awake mode, it's will drain little more power as modem IRQ is not suspending.
settingsPane.name: Modem Sleep State

spinner.description: Select Modem Sleep State
spinner.name: Modem State

settingsPane.description: BCL polls the battery monitor system for various values such as voltage, current and temperature through the battery. It prevents reboots by setting thresholds and when the threshold is passed, it will throttle or unplug cores, Disable for Performance Improvement but you device will sudden reboot in system/battery pressure. Kernel default is Enabled.
settingsPane.name: Battery Current Limit

spinner.description: Select Battery Current Limit for Screen ON State
spinner.name: BCL State

spinner.description: Select Battery Current Limit for Screen OFF State
spinner.name: Suspend BCL State

settingsPane.description: Set Power Policy to allows devfreq governors to scale the frequency of a device clock. it can scale any devfreq device based on the current policy. It can be the Reason of HEAT-UP and Core Throttle with Performance Based Policies.
settingsPane.name: Clock Frequency Scale Policy

checkbox.description: The cpubw devfreq device delegates the speed of the DDR bus, so it's speed is directly correlated with frame drops. Boost it when a new frame is ready to be rendered to the display to reduce overall frame drops.
checkbox.name: CPUBW Boost on Rendering
checkbox.label: Boost on new frame Render

seekBar.description: Set the time for ms that CPUBW devfreq device boost to the max when userspace launches an app. CPUBW will last longer in max frequency if you set higher value (Default: 1250 ms).
seekBar.name: CPUBW Boost time

spinner.description: Select cpubw (cpu bandwidth) Policy. Default means Kernel Stock Parameters.
spinner.name: CPUBW Clock Frequency Scale Policy

spinner.description: Select suspend cpubw Policy.
spinner.name: Suspend CPUBW Clock Frequency Scale Policy

spinner.description: Select gpubw (gpu bandwidth) Policy. Default means Kernel Stock Parameters.
spinner.name: GPUBW Clock Frequency Scale Policy

spinner.description: Select suspend gpubw Policy.
spinner.name: Suspend GPUBW Clock Frequency Scale Policy

settingsPane.description: Customize the CPU Active Governor for each cluster. A governor defines the strategy how to scale CPU cores up and down across frequencies based on system load. Default for all cores is Interactive. If you found that cpu is very resposible to tasks and jump to max frequency most of the time or frequency stuck at max for both cluster all the time when running app on both foreground and background then switch to Alucard or Darkness which has different frequency calculation method to keep cpu calm. it's a matter between cpu and governor frequency calculation.
settingsPane.name: CPU Active Governor

spinner.description: Select governor for little cluster. Some governor's can be unstable on it. It's recommended to leave it as is.
spinner.name: Little Cluster Governor

spinner.description: Select governor for big cluster.
spinner.name: Big Cluster Governor

settingsPane.description: Set the profile for Interactive Familly CPU Governor for each cluster. only works if you selected them in the CPU Active Governor section (interactive, impulse, cultivation). the OFF means use default parameters of the current governor but reboot needed.
settingsPane.name: Interactive CPU Governor Profile

spinner.description: Select the little cluster Profile.
spinner.name: little cluster Interactive Profile

spinner.description: Select the big cluster Profile.
spinner.name: big cluster Interactive Profile

spinner.description: Select the little cluster Boost state. Enable means indefinite speed boost active. set it to disable to save power or Enable if you enabled extreme power saving profile to compensate performance drop.
spinner.name: little cluster Interactive Boost

spinner.description: Select the big cluster Boost state.
spinner.name: big cluster Interactive Boost

spinner.description: Select Hispeed Frequency. It is Hi speed to bump to from low speed when load burst. set it to low frequency to save power.
spinner.name: Little Cluster Hispeed Frequency

spinner.description: Select Hispeed Frequency.
spinner.name: big Cluster Hispeed Frequency

spinner.description: Select Suspend Hispeed Frequency.
spinner.name: Suspend Little Cluster Hispeed Frequency

spinner.description: Select Suspend Hispeed Frequency.
spinner.name: Suspend big Cluster Hispeed Frequency

settingsPane.description: Set the parameters if you enabled Gabriel Plus governor above.
settingsPane.name: Gabriel Plus Governor Tuning

seekBar.description: Select big cluster idle Threshold. If average load is lower than idle threshold, the system is idle and should not be interrupted by CPUFreq governor timer. it's a common parameter with gabriel and gabriel plus. (Default: 20).
seekBar.name: Big Cluster idle Threshold

seekBar.description: Select little cluster idle Threshold. (Default: 20).
seekBar.name: Little Cluster idle Threshold

seekBar.description: Select big cluster idle Sample Rate which works in Power Save mode. Switch sample rate to idle sample rate when system is idle to save power. it's a common parameter with gabriel and gabriel plus. (Default: 20000).
seekBar.name: Big Cluster idle Sample Rate

seekBar.description: Select little cluster idle Sample Rate which works in Power Save mode. (Default: 20000).
seekBar.name: Little Cluster idle Sample Rate

seekBar.description: Select big cluster Max Local Load. Target frequency direclty jump beyond hispeed frequency and ignore above hispeed delay if cpu load exceeds Max local load. (Default: 100).
seekBar.name: Big Cluster max local load

seekBar.description: Select little cluster Max Local Load. (Default: 100).
seekBar.name: Little Cluster max local load

seekBar.description: Select big cluster Sampling Down Factor. When CPU jumps to the highest frequency, CPU will last longer in higher frequencies before recalculating if you set higher value. (Default: 0).
seekBar.name: Big Cluster Sampling Down Factor

seekBar.description: Select little cluster Sampling Down Factor. (Default: 0).
seekBar.name: Little Cluster Sampling Down Factor

spinner.description: Select Little Cluster Two Phase Frequency. Two phase scheduling idle/busy phases to prevent from jumping directly to max freq.
spinner.name: Little Cluster Two Phase Frequency

spinner.description: Select Big Cluster Two Phase Frequency.
spinner.name: Big Cluster Two Phase Frequency

spinner.description: Select Little Cluster Frequency calculation threshold. Avoid freq oscillations up to this threshold and allow for dynamic changes above.
spinner.name: Little Cluster Frequency calculation threshold

spinner.description: Select Big Cluster Frequency calculation threshold.
spinner.name: Big Cluster Frequency calculation threshold

settingsPane.description: Set the profile for custom governors. Set here if you chosen same cpu governor in CPU Active Governor section.
settingsPane.name: Custom CPU Governor Profile

spinner.description: Select the little cluster Profile.
spinner.name: little cluster Profile

spinner.description: Select the big cluster Profile.
spinner.name: big cluster Profile

settingsPane.description: Customize the Touch Boost Control settings. Touch Boost means, the CPU frequency is boosted to a higher level when the touch screen is being used. It gives smoother UI but use slightly more power.
settingsPane.name: Touch Boost Controls

checkbox.description: Boost CPU when a new frame is ready to be rendered to the display to reduce overall frame drops.
checkbox.name: CPU Boost on Rendering
checkbox.label: Boost on new frame Render

spinner.description: Boost the CPU when a touch is Detected.
spinner.name: Main Cpu Boost Switch

spinner.description: Enable scheduler boost to migrate tasks to big cluster.
spinner.name: Scheduler boost

spinner.description: Set the Maximum CPU Boost frequency for Little Cluster. When touch is being detected, CPU frequency will be locked to selected frequency for the defined CPU Touch Boost duration.
spinner.name: Little Cluster Boost Frequency

spinner.description: Set the Maximum CPU Boost frequency for big Cluster.
spinner.name: big Cluster Boost Frequency

seekBar.description: Set the time that core is locked on Maximum Boost frequency. 10 ms is equal to 0.01 sec (Default: 500 ms).
seekBar.name: CPU Touch Boost duration

settingsPane.description: Customize the CPU Power Saving settings.
settingsPane.name: CPU Power Controls

seekBar.description: Select big cluster CPU Governor Sample Rate which works in Power Save mode. The lower the value, the faster response you'll get, but quicker battery will be discharging (Default: 20000).
seekBar.name: Big Cluster CPU Governor Sample Rate

seekBar.description: Select little cluster CPU Governor Sample Rate which works in Power Save mode (Default: 20000).
seekBar.name: Little Cluster CPU Governor Sample Rate

seekBar.description: Select big cluster Suspend Sample Rate (Default: 20000).
seekBar.name: Big Cluster Suspend Sample Rate

seekBar.description: Select little cluster Suspend Sample Rate (Default: 20000).
seekBar.name: Little Cluster Suspend Sample Rate

spinner.description: Select CPU Governor Power Control mode. Power Save mode activates options below, so you can set the CPU Governor Sample Rate as you like. When performance mode is selected, CPU Governor Sample Rate is set to it's Maximum response (10000 rate) and other rates will be ignored.
spinner.name: Power Save Switch

checkbox.description: Power-efficient Workqueues help to reduce power consumption at the cost of slight performance decrease. By enabling this, PE Workqueues are used for unbound scheduled works to reduce the load on sibling CPU cores and queuing work only on CPU0.
checkbox.name: Power-efficient Workqueues
checkbox.label: Power-efficient Workqueues

checkbox.description: By enabling this setting, kernel will obey only Stweak settings and set the frequencies selected below. This option works whenever screen is ON or OFF.
checkbox.name: CPU-Tweaks
checkbox.label: CPU-Tweaks

settingsPane.description: Set the Maximum CPU Frequency for each cluster separately. Other apps or services won't overcome them.
settingsPane.name: Maximum CPU Frequency

spinner.description: Select Maximum little cluster frequency. It works only when CPU-Tweaks is enabled.
spinner.name: Max little Cluster Frequency

spinner.description: Select Maximum big cluster frequency. It works only when CPU-Tweaks is enabled.
spinner.name: Max big Cluster Frequency

settingsPane.description: Set the minimum CPU frequency for each cluster separately.
settingsPane.name: Minimum CPU Frequency

spinner.description: Select minimum little cluster frequency. Note that, it can't be higher than Maximum little cluster freq. It works only when CPU-Tweaks is enabled.
spinner.name: min little cluster Frequency

spinner.description: Select minimum big cluster frequency. Note that, it can't be higher than Maximum big cluster freq. It works only when CPU-Tweaks is enabled.
spinner.name: min big cluster Frequency

settingsPane.description: Set the Suspend Frequency.
settingsPane.name: CPU Suspend Frequency

spinner.description: Maximum Allowed CPU frequency when screen is OFF, but phone is awake (cases like any app holds wakelock, music, radio etc.). It has effect ONLY when screen is OFF. If screen is ON, normal Maximum allowed frequency take place.
spinner.name: Max Little Cluster CPU Frequency

spinner.description: Maximum Allowed CPU frequency.
spinner.name: Max Big Cluster CPU Frequency

spinner.description: Minimum Allowed CPU frequency.
spinner.name: Min Little Cluster CPU Frequency

spinner.description: Minimum Allowed CPU frequency.
spinner.name: Min Big Cluster CPU Frequency

settingsPane.description: Boosts all available cpus to max frequency after recieving an input notification from the fingerprint sensor to reduce lag. (Default: disabled)
settingsPane.name: Fingerprint Boost

spinner.description: Select fingerprint boost state.
spinner.name: Fingerprint Boost State

settingsPane.description: Set the HMP Scheduler Profile.
settingsPane.name: HMP Scheduler

spinner.description: Tweak HMP Scheduler for Cluster utilization. the Balance and Battery profile will route tasks to little cluster most of the time when using interactive, ondemand, conservative cpu governor family. kernel will load it's default hmp parameters if you select default profile but reboot needed.
spinner.name: HMP Scheduler

spinner.description: Suspend HMP Scheduler for Cluster utilization.
spinner.name: Suspend HMP Scheduler

spinner.description: This option optimizes the scheduler for common desktop workloads by automatically creating and populating task groups. This separation of workloads isolates aggressive CPU burners (like build jobs) from desktop applications.
spinner.name: Sched Autogroup

settingsPane.description: The cpuset subsystem assigns individual CPUs to group of Tasks like top apps, system background tasks, foreground tasks, etc.
settingsPane.name: CPUSET Tuning

spinner.description: Select cpuset Profile.
spinner.name: CPUSET Tuning

spinner.description: Suspend cpuset Profile.
spinner.name: Suspend cpuset Tuning

settingsPane.description: Set the Core Control Parameters for Screen ON state. Kernel Scheduler will manage online cores for idle and workload state if you put it to Maximum. Maximum online core is 8 and Minimum is 1.
settingsPane.name: Awake Core Control Tuning

spinner.description: Perfd is a system performance daemon that provides real-time access to system performance metrics, locally or remotely. it will change minimum big cores online if enabled, mostly in miui. miui default is enabled.
spinner.name: Performance Daemon Control

spinner.description: By selecting this option Core Control Preference little cluster to be more online.
spinner.name: Little Cluster Online Preference

spinner.description: Set min cores online for Little Cluster. (Default : 4)
spinner.name: Little Cluster Min Core Control

spinner.description: Set max cores online for Little Cluster. (Default : 4)
spinner.name: Little Cluster Max Core Control

spinner.description: By selecting this option Core Control Preference big cluster to be more online.
spinner.name: big Cluster Online Preference

spinner.description: Set min cores online for Big Cluster. (Default : 2)
spinner.name: Big Cluster Min Core Control

spinner.description: Set max cores online for Big Cluster. (Default : 4)
spinner.name: Big Cluster Max Core Control

seekBar.name: Little Cluster Down Threshold

spinner.description: Set min cores online for Little Cluster.

spinner.description: Set min cores online for Big Cluster.
spinner.name: Big Cluster Min Core Control

spinner.description: Set max cores online for Big Cluster.

seekBar.description: Select little cluster Core Control Busy Down Threshold.
seekBar.name: Little Cluster Down Threshold

settingsPane.description: Select the GPU Governor. After doing some changes, hit button to update GPU Governor.
settingsPane.name: GPU Governors And Settings

spinner.description: Select GPU Governor that will control GPU frequency. If selected Performance governor, then the GPU will be at Max frequency all the time (Default: MSM Adreno).
spinner.name: GPU Active Governor

spinner.description: Select Suspend GPU Governor.
spinner.name: Suspend GPU Governor

spinner.description: Select GPU Maximum frequency only when needed because some higher frequencies can be unstable. Stock MIUI UI start lag under 160 MHz with msm-adreno governor. (Default: 425 MHz).
spinner.name: Max GPU Frequency

spinner.description: Select GPU Minimum frequency when GPU is IDLE. Stock MIUI UI has better response with msm-adreno governor if min gpu frequency set to 375 MHz. (Default: 375 MHz).
spinner.name: Min GPU Frequency

spinner.description: Select GPU Initial Frequency (Power Level). (Default: 375 MHz).
spinner.name: GPU Initial Frequency

settingsPane.description: Here you can change the way to lower the power consumptions while maintaining high-performance with msm-adreno-tz.
settingsPane.name: Adreno Idler

spinner.description: Select Adreno Idler State
spinner.name: Idler State

seekBar.description: Threshold for determining if the given work load is idle. (Default: 20%).
seekBar.name: Down differential Value

seekBar.description: Number of events to wait before ramping down the frequency. (Default: 20%).
seekBar.name: Idle Wait Value

seekBar.description: Try to ramp down the frequency if set to a higher value. (Default: 5000).
seekBar.name: Idle Work Load Value

settingsPane.description: Customize I/O settings.
settingsPane.name: I/O Tuning

spinner.description: Set the Maximum number of KiloBytes to read-ahead from device storage, (Default: 128 KiB).
spinner.name: Internal KiloBytes to Read Ahead

spinner.description: Set the Maximum number of KiloBytes to read-ahead for external storage. Reboot needed. Depends on Cortexbrain I/O Tweak. (Default: 512 KiB).
spinner.name: External KiloBytes to Read Ahead

button.description: Push Trim Now button in order to speed up Read and Write Access Time. It's good to use it once in a day or two. WAIT some sec for getting cleanup report. stweak will FREEZE, don't panic and wait some sec.
button.name: Trim System and Data
button.label: Trim NOW

spinner.description: Set the I/O scheduler for internal storage for Screen ON state (Default: ZEN).
spinner.name: Default Internal I/O Scheduler Awake

spinner.description: Set the I/O scheduler for internal storage for Screen OFF state (Default: NOOP).
spinner.name: Default Internal I/O Scheduler Sleep

spinner.description: Set the I/O scheduler for external storage for Screen ON state (Default: ZEN).
spinner.name: Default External I/O Scheduler Awake

spinner.description: Set the I/O scheduler for external storage for Screen OFF state (Default: NOOP).
spinner.name: Default External I/O Scheduler Sleep

settingsPane.description: Set the f2fs tuning parameters if you use this file system.
settingsPane.name: F2FS Tuning

spinner.description: Control readaheading inode block in read directory. Improves the performance of readdir + stat with much number of files. (Default: Disable)
spinner.name: readaheading inode block in readdir

settingsPane.description: Customize Memory and OOM (Out Of Memory) prevention settings.
settingsPane.name: Memory Tuning

checkbox.description: Enabling Adaptive LMK will increase responsiveness at the cost of reduced multitasking capabilities and battery life. It helps to free up RAM faster when low RAM and vmpressure is in range from 85% to 94%. Apps will be cleared from RAM.
checkbox.name: Adaptive LMK
checkbox.label: Adaptive LMK

seekBar.description: When RAM pressure is higher than set in here, LMK is ordered to release RAM and allow faster load for something BIG into memory. The effect is that apps are loading faster. Lower the value, more apps gets killed. For best performance, keep it in range from 85% to 90% (Default: 85%).
seekBar.name: Adaptive LMK Pressure Range

seekBar.description: When RAM pressure is higher than set above, and RAM is lower than set here, kernel will start releasing RAM by stopping background apps. Value calculation here is based on this formula PR * 4096 (example: 68 * 4096 = 278MB free RAM) default 68 PR
seekBar.name: Adaptive LMK Lowest RAM Allowed

checkbox.description: It helps to reduce used RAM for each app that is running in the background. When vm memory pressure jumps higher and system needs more RAM for something BIG, then process starts to shrink used RAM by background apps. It's also shrinks the ZRAM swap (if enabled) in order to reduce CPU power usage when RAM is free.
checkbox.name: Process Memory Reclaim
checkbox.label: Process Reclaim

seekBar.description: Control for Max vm pressure for process memory reclaim. It allows to shrink RAM from other apps when vm pressure is in range from 50% to (set here) value. When value is lower that default (90%), then less RAM shrinks when something BIG should have been be loaded to RAM. It will reduce CPU usage when loading big apps, but loads it slower, as memory should be first freed by LMK (Default: 80%).
seekBar.name: Max Process Reclaim Pressure

spinner.description: Set the mode for low memory management (lowmemkiller function). More aggressive equals more free RAM, but more apps gets killed.
spinner.name: OOM Level Screen

spinner.description: Set the low memory reserve ratio mode. Higher ratio gives more free RAM. If you see that your RAM and system is always loaded and device is lagging, then use recommended or high pressure setting.
spinner.name: Low Memory Reserve

settingsPane.description: How you adjust these depends on what you’re trying to do. increasing dirty_background_ratio and dirty_ratio has positive effects on performance. In theory, by allowing more dirty pages to exist in memory you’ll rewrite the same blocks over and over in cache, and just need to do one write every so often to the actual disk. in this case increase the dirty_expire_centisecs parameter to allow more time in cache. Beyond the increased risk of data loss, you also run the risk of long I/O pauses if that cache gets full and needs to destage.
settingsPane.name: Cache Tuning

seekBar.description: The more is set, the more memory will be used as writing buffer for background operations. Buffer will be released when it needs more free RAM. If you have 2 GiB RAM and set it to 10% then 200 MiB of data that can be sitting in RAM before something is done.
seekBar.name: Dirty Background Ratio

seekBar.description: The more is set, the more memory will be used for real time operations writing buffer. Buffer will be released when it needs more free RAM. This is absolute maximum amount of system memory that can be filled with dirty pages before everything must get committed to disk. When the system gets to this point all new I/O blocks until dirty pages have been written to disk. This is often the source of long I/O pauses
seekBar.name: Dirty Ratio

seekBar.description: how long something can be in cache before it needs to be written. When the pdflush/flush/kdmflush processes kick in they will check to see how old a dirty page is, and if it’s older than this value it’ll be written asynchronously to disk. Since holding a dirty page in memory is unsafe this is also a safeguard against data loss. (3000cs equals to 30 sec)
seekBar.name: Dirty expire centisecs

seekBar.description: how often the pdflush/flush/kdmflush processes wake up and check to see if work needs to be done.
seekBar.name: Dirty writeback centisecs

seekBar.description: Set 0, the kernel attempts to estimate the amount of free memory left when userspace requests more memory. 1, the kernel pretends there is always enough memory until it actually runs out. This feature can be very useful because there are a lot of programs that malloc() huge amounts of memory just-in-case and don't use much of it.
seekBar.name: Overcommit Memory

seekBar.description: Percentage of phisical memory size to include in overcommit calculation. with overcommit at 100, the kernel will not allow applications to allocate any more memory than you have (swap + ram). Setting it at less than 100 means that you will never use all your memory.
seekBar.name: Overcommit Ratio

seekBar.description: This is used to force the Linux VM to keep a minimum number of kilobytes free (keep reserve to prevent OOM). The VM uses this number to compute a watermark[WMARK_MIN] value for each lowmem zone in the system. Each lowmem zone gets a number of reserved free pages based proportionally on its size. This controls the amount of memory that is kept free for use by special reserves including atomic allocations (those which cannot wait for reclaim). This should not normally be lowered unless the system is being very carefully tuned for memory usage (normally useful for embedded rather than server applications). If page allocation failure messages and stack traces are frequently seen in logs, min_free_kbytes could be increased until the errors disappear. There is no need for concern, if these messages are very infrequent. The default value depends on the amount of RAM.
seekBar.name: Min free kbytes

seekBar.description: It controls the tendency of the kernel for reclaiming memory, which is used for caching the directory and all the information needed by the kernel to manipulate a file or a directory (inode objects) (Default: 100%). At the default value of vfs_cache_pressure=100 the kernel will attempt to reclaim dentries and inodes at a fair rate with respect to pagecache and swapcache reclaim. Decreasing vfs_cache_pressure causes the kernel to prefer to retain dentry and inode caches. When vfs_cache_pressure=0, the kernel will never reclaim dentries and inodes due to memory pressure and this can easily lead to out-of-memory conditions. Increasing vfs_cache_pressure beyond 100 causes the kernel to prefer to reclaim dentries and inodes.
seekBar.name: Vfs Cache Pressure

checkbox.description: This enables or disables killing the OOM-triggering task in out-of-memory situations. If this is set disable, the OOM killer will scan through the entire tasklist and select a task based on heuristics to kill. This normally selects a rogue memory-hogging task that frees up a large amount of memory when killed. If this is set to enable, the OOM killer simply kills the task that triggered the out-of-memory condition. This avoids the expensive tasklist scan.
checkbox.name: oom kill allocating task
checkbox.label: oom kill allocating task

button.description: Release all cached and buffered files from RAM. WAIT some sec for getting cleanup report. stweak will FREEZE, don't panic and wait some sec.
button.name: Clear RAM Cache
button.label: Clear RAM Cache

spinner.description: Release all cached and buffered files from RAM every time Screen goes OFF.
spinner.name: Auto Clear Ram Cache

button.description: Push Clear Now button in order to free RAM from unused buffers and cache.
button.name: Clear file cache
button.label: Clear NOW

settingsPane.description: SWAP function is using swap storage placed in /data folder in order to expand RAM and leave more physical RAM for apps working in the background. Enable this option only, if you have free space and you really need that RAM expansion. You will notice slightly faster battery discharging and slower I/O read/write operations. It can be combined with ZRAM.
settingsPane.name: Linux SWAP

spinner.description: SWAP Size Controller. The more is set, the bigger SWAP file will be. It takes time to create SWAP file (about 50 sec).
spinner.name: SWAP Selector

settingsPane.description: ZRAM Control Module take real RAM and compress it by 35-40% to create more FREE RAM for apps. Compression method by default is LZ4. The more RAM is allocated in ZRAM, the more physical RAM is given to user at cost of CPU power and faster battery discharging. When switching ZRAM size from one to another, decompression and new compression will take some TIME. In some cases that will take more than some min. In that time, Stweak will FREEZE. DO NOT PANIC!. Do not kill the app.
settingsPane.name: ZRAM

spinner.description: ZRAM Compression/Decompressin Algorithm Selector. This is algorithm of Compressing/Decompressing the ZRAM by Crypto API which can be faster in Compression/Decompression or deliver smaller Compressed size but slower in Compression/Decompression. (Default: lz4)
spinner.name: ZRAM Compression Algorithm

spinner.description: ZRAM Size Controller. The more is set, the more free RAM you'll get in cost of CPU power. But it's really low usage and device is operating GREAT! This is memory based module, so storage is not killed over time. Before proceeding PLEASE read the instruction ABOVE! (Default: 512 MiB)
spinner.name: ZRAM Selector

button.description: Create ZRAM again in order of changed compression algorithm or flushing zram. This process needs zram to be initialising again and It will takes time to flush zram, so you can reboot the phone instead to speed it up or wait until zram flush.
button.name: Initialise ZRAM
button.label: Initialise ZRAM

seekBar.description: Controls ZRAM/SWAP allocation. The higher value is set, then ZRAM/SWAP will use more storage instead of real RAM, in order to give you more free RAM. The only cost is slight performance drop. If you have enabled swap, then the higher a number set here, the more the system will swap. It is not recommended to enable swap as it is very resource heavy. Use ZRAM instead!. By setting it to the maximum of 100 the kernel will swap very aggressively. By setting it to 0 the kernel will only swap to protect against an Out-Of-Memory condition.
seekBar.name: Swappiness

settingsPane.description: UKSM lets the hypervisor system to share identical memory pages amongst different processes.
settingsPane.name: UKSM

spinner.description: UKSM Main Switch
spinner.name: Ultra Kernel Samepage Merging

spinner.description: By enabling this option UKSM continue or start working in sleep mode and Disabling means it will stop working during sleep mode and back to work if UKSM Awake Switch has been enabled. Depends on Cortexbrain.
spinner.name: Suspend Ultra Kernel Samepage Merging

spinner.description: UKSM CPU Governor Power when screen is ON. You can set high or low operational power for scanning and sharing memory across apps (Default: Medium Power).
spinner.name: UKSM CPU AWAKE GOVERNOR

spinner.description: UKSM CPU Governor Power when screen is OFF. You can set high or low operational power for scanning and sharing memory across apps (Default: No Power).
spinner.name: Suspend UKSM CPU GOVERNOR

seekBar.description: The lower is set, more RAM we can gain at cost of slight performance (Default: 1000 ms).
seekBar.name: UKSM Scan Delay Interval

seekBar.description: Max CPU Usage when merging pages (Default: 10%).
seekBar.name: UKSM Max CPU Usage

seekBar.description: Max CPU Usage when merging pages while in Sleep mode (Default: 1%).
seekBar.name: Suspend UKSM Max CPU Usage

settingsPane.description: Battery Tweaks.
settingsPane.name: Battery Tweaks Control

button.description: Calibrate Battery. Push this button if you installed Rom recently or Battery Diagram have Flat Drop Energy status or Increase While not Charging or battery indicator stucked at a value.
button.name: Remove batterystats.bin
button.label: Calibrate Battery

button.description: Check charge/drain status. Battery will charge faster if there are few Power Eater Resources like Screen on,Downloding via Mobile data,etc and the Battery Temperature is not High. It takes a while to calculate current when un/plug the charger or new resource has been activated.
button.name: Battery Current Status
button.label: Battery Current Check

settingsPane.description: Fast Charge and Battery options.
settingsPane.name: USB and AC Charger control

spinner.description: Device will charge faster when connected with USB. Replug the calbe when changing this option.
spinner.name: USB Fast Charge

spinner.description: This option will Control Maximum Allowed Current Gain from an AC Charger. Charging rate control has tolerance around this threshold. (default 1800).
spinner.name: AC Charger Current limiter

spinner.description: This Battery Temperature control is a Threshold to limit maximum charging rate. The higher value is set, then Higher current you get. (default 50° C).
spinner.name: Battery Temperature Control

settingsPane.description: Here you can set Driver Message logging options for kernel debugging.
settingsPane.name: Drivers Logging

checkbox.description: Kernel Logging can be switched ON and OFF. if you Turn this OFF kernel no more logging it's activities and DEV can't help you in case of Panic or etc.
checkbox.name: DMESG logging ON and OFF
checkbox.label: Printk Mode

checkbox.description: By Turning OFF this option the Low Memory Killer won't log app killing info in DMESG. if you Turn this OFF then DEV can't help you in case of Panic or etc.
checkbox.name: Low Memory Killer Log
checkbox.label: LMK Log Mode

settingsPane.description: Customize ROM Auto Brightness settings.
settingsPane.name: min/max Auto Backlight Control

seekBar.description: Set the min auto backlight allowable value.
seekBar.name: min Backlight Level

seekBar.description: Set the max auto backlight allowable value.
seekBar.name: max Backlight Level

button.description: Check for current Brightness Level.
button.name: Brightness Level
button.label: Brightness Level Check

settingsPane.description: Customize Headphone/Speaker Loudness.
settingsPane.name: Sound Control

seekBar.description: Set the Left gain.
seekBar.name: Left Gain

seekBar.description: Set the Right gain.
seekBar.name: Right Gain

button.description: Push Apply Now button in order to apply left and righ sound gain.
button.name: Apply Sound Gain
button.label: Apply NOW

settingsPane.description: Congestion control controls traffic entry into a telecommunications network, to avoid congestive collapse by avoiding oversubscription by reducing the rate of packets.
settingsPane.name: TCP Algorithms

spinner.description: This algorithms controls the Data Transmission Protocol used by many Internet applications. It needs from user to investigate from net and check what's the BEST setting for him. If USER is lazy to read Google, leave it as default (Cubic or Bic depends on phone model).
spinner.name: Net Congestion Control

settingsPane.description: WIFI Settings. Some devices can have a problem with connecting while using DHCP method and obtaining IP address. You can use button below to clean WiFi lease and try again or use static method obtaining IP.
settingsPane.name: WIFI

button.description: Clean WIFI DHCP IP Lease. Sometimes when connecting using WiFi, DHCP method will failure on Android WiFi (stuck on obtaining IP address). This option will clean the lease!
button.name: Clean WIFI Lease
button.label: Clean WIFI Lease

settingsPane.description: Control Android Debugging Bridge (ADB).
settingsPane.name: Android Debugging

spinner.description: Select ADB State
spinner.name: ADB State

settingsPane.description: Change GPS settings.
settingsPane.name: GPS

spinner.description: Set GPS Time Zone for faster GPS lock. Use your current time zone.
spinner.name: GPS Region

button.description: Check for current GPS ZONE.
button.name: GPS ZONE
button.label: GPS Zone Check

checkbox.description: Enable INIT.D scripts RUN on boot. If you put scripts in INIT.D and enable it, default SuperSu scripts will run on boot from INIT.D.
checkbox.name: INIT.D Scripts RUN control
checkbox.label: Enable INIT.D scripts RUN Control

settingsPane.description: INIT Porcess Fixer. Select patch on boot to patch both binaries at boot if stweak found init process is mostly active or push patch button for each of them one by one if you are sure about draining battery by init process, it's better to patch one binary and check idle drain then patch another one if idle drain didn't fix by first one.
settingsPane.name: INIT Porcess Fixer

spinner.description: Enable init process fixer if you found that init process is draining the battery. it will apply only once per Rom or push Restore Rom's Binaries button to apply it again at boot. (Default: Don't Load).
spinner.name: Patch On Boot

spinnerItem.name: Don't load init fixer on boot.

button.description: Push this button to apply the patch only to dpmd binary.
button.name: Patch dpmd binary
button.label: Patch dpmd binary

button.description: Push this button to apply the patch only to irq balance binary.
button.name: Patch irq balance binary
button.label: Patch irq balance binary

button.description: Push this button to Restore Rom's Binaries which Patched with init process fixer, in case of you found it's not working or suddenly applied in a rom which doesn't have init process battery drainage and start draining battery by init process. It will remove restriction of applying the patch for 2nd time so disable init process fixer if you don't want it to apply at boot again.
button.name: Remove Init Process Patch
button.label: Restore Rom's Binaries

settingsPane.description: Key layout patcher is a generic key layout modifier to remap mi-headphone buttons and hardware navigation keys.
settingsPane.name: Patch Key Layout

button.description: Push this button to apply the patch.
button.name: Patch key layout
button.label: Patch key layout

button.description: Push this button to Restore original key layout of rom.
button.name: Restore key layout
button.label: Restore key layout

settingsPane.description: This script manipulates many kernel settings, based on chosen Stweak profile + settings and screen state (ON/OFF) - we call it CortexBrain. To reset the kernel-settings after disabling a tweak, you must reboot the device.
settingsPane.name: CortexBrain Tweaks

spinner.description: Enable the CortexBrain Background Process. Disabling it means, losing the functions that sets different settings for screen state (ON/OFF).
spinner.name: CortexBrain-Background-Process

button.description: Touch to see, if the CortexBrain Background Process is running.
button.name: Check Background Process
button.label: CHECK SERVICE

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable ICMP only Firewall-Tweaks (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: Firewall-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Firewall-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable the DATA turns off while screen is off function.
checkbox.name: Auto-DATA
checkbox.label: Force Auto-Data

seekBar.description: Here you can set a delay before DATA is forced to OFF when screen is turned off.
seekBar.name: DATA Turn Off Delay (in sec)

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable the Wifi turns off while screen is off function.
checkbox.name: Auto-Wifi
checkbox.label: Force Auto-Wifi

seekBar.description: Here you can set a delay before WIFI is forced to OFF when screen is turned off.
seekBar.name: WIFI Turn Off Delay (in sec)

button.name: Profile Check

button.description: I'm feeling lucky

settingsPane.description: Backup or restore current profile after installing or updating kernel. Some settings will work only after reboot.
settingsPane.name: Profile Backup or Restore

button.description: Backup Gabriel User Settings.
button.name: Settings Backup
button.label: Backup Settings

button.description: Restore Gabriel User Settings.
button.name: Settings Restore
button.label: Restore Settings

settingsPane.description: Debug to SD-Card.
settingsPane.name: Bug-Report

button.description: Bug-Report for Kernel, if a reboot or a freeze was performed and log was created with it's name part contains USELESS phase, then there is nothing to be done here. There is no need to upload it to thread for investigation.
button.name: Kernel Debug
button.label: KERNEL-CRASH-DEBUG

button.description: Active Kernel/System Debug Report, use to report BUG with kernel or system in LIVE, NOT after crash, reboot or freeze. if something is wrong, upload debug for investigation.
button.name: Kernel Active Debug
button.label: KERNEL-ACTIVE-DEBUG

button.description: Bug-Report for apps. Make sure that Logcat is Enabled before using this option. Remember, it's useless for kernel DEV and it's only needed for ROM DEV!
button.name: App-Bug
button.label: ROM-Logcat
